laboratory_examinations.findings: Extensive periduodenal inflammation around the second and third part of the duodenum. Hemorrhagic material present within inflammatory debris/phlegmon. No pancreatic duct dilatation. Gallbladder contains sludge and sludge balls but no definite evidence of gallstones.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The duodenum was reportedly normal at recent EGD, indicating potential progression of inflammatory changes.
